node.title: Bloomfield, experts and officials explain home isolation and supports
node.description: One in 10 people going to Middlemore Hospital's emergency department are testing positive for Covid-19, the Director-General of Health has revealed at a briefing on how home isolation will work.

node.title: Immigration NZ to better manage second round of residence visa applications
node.description: Up to 1500 individuals will be able to apply each day from 21 February in the order of the date the individual submitted their EOI. They will receive an email from INZ on the day they are able toâ€¦

node.title: Sadowski-Synnott heads to Canada
node.description: Zoi Sadowski-Synnott heads to the backcountry to celebrate remarkable Olympic medal haul

node.title: Four people rescued from burning motor launch off Wellington's South Coast
node.description: Maritime police say a fishing boat crew managed to get the four adults off the 12-metre launch and they are now being transferred to the police launch, the Lady Elizabeth.

node.title: First Black Congressman honored at U.S. Capitol
node.description: "Study the history. Know their history," said Representative Jim Clyburn in an interview with CBS News.

node.title: Commonwealth Games tipped to return to Australia
node.description: The 2026 Commonwealth Games are set to be awarded to Victoria in Australia.

node.title: Doubling of profit from construction sector lifts Fletcher Building result
node.description: Fletcher Building has reported a solid lift in first-half profit as it benefited from a strong housing market and building boom.

node.title: Labour holds strong, National on the up in latest political poll
node.description: The latest Taxpayers' Union Curia Poll has Labour inching up about a point to 42.3 percent and National gaining 5.4 points to 38.4 percent since last month's poll results.

node.title: Infants born to vaccinated mothers are less likely to be hospitalized with COVID
node.description: Babies born to mothers who were vaccinated while pregnant were 61% less likely to be hospitalized with COVID-19.

node.title: Avocado, kiwifruit growers counting cost of Cyclone Dovi's winds
node.description: The strong winds that lashed the country at the weekend have caused significant damage to some kiwifruit and avocado orchards in the Bay of Plenty.

node.title: Government to deliver Budget on 19 May
node.description: The date has been announced for this year's Budget, which Finance Minister Grant Robertson says will focus on planned health reforms and meeting climate change goals.

node.title: Prince Andrew reaches settlement in US civil sex assault case
node.description: Prince Andrew has settled a civil sexual assault case brought against him in the US by Virginia Giuffre, court documents show.

node.title: 'You will see some tow activity today': Police ready to get protesters' vehicles moved
node.description: The Police Commissioner admits some tow companies are reluctant to help with the removal of vehicles near Parliament but says some towing will begin today. Audio

node.title: CNN executive Allison Gollust resigns after probe found she violated policies, CNN says
node.description: The announcement comes nearly two weeks after CNN president Jeff Zucker resigned over an undisclosed "consensual relationship" with a colleague, later reported to be Gollust.

node.title: 'Workplace, tamariki and a school' among testing sites in Marton Covid-19 outbreak
node.description: Public health units are testing contacts of nine active cases in the Marton Covid-19 cluster, including at a workplace and a school.

node.title: Woman working at lodge on Milford Track contracts Covid-19
node.description: A worker based at a lodge on the Milford Track has tested positive for Covid-19.

node.title: Omicron phase two: Covid-19 cases will soon be doing their own contact tracing
node.description: People with Covid-19 are set to become their own contact tracers, and some details of an online system due to go live soon have been revealed.

node.title: 'So I get raped, he gets away with it' - Young woman horrified and revictimised during trial
node.description: You think you're doing the right thing by reporting your rape. You think it might help prevent the same thing happening to others. But what happens if your attacker is found not guilty?

node.title: 4-year-old reported missing in 2019 found alive under staircase, police say
node.description: Three suspects have been arrested in connection to her disappearance.

node.title: Clerk who spread election fraud conspiracies runs for secretary of state
node.description: Mesa County Clerk Tina Peters, a Republican, has been probed for alleged security breach involving voting equipment in her office.

node.title: Democrats weigh gas tax holiday
node.description: A group of Senate Democrats proposes suspending the federal gas tax through the end of the year.

node.title: Govt says' targeted support' on the way for hospitality firms
node.description: Cafes and restaurants on the brink of collapse because of Covid-19 restrictions are being promised some relief by the government but still don't know what that will be.

node.title: January 6 committee subpoenas others tied to false elector scheme
node.description: The panel's chair Bennie Thompson said the committee has found the plan was directed at least in part from the former president's campaign.

node.title: Bill to ban conversion practices passes third reading
node.description: The Conversion Practices Prohibition Legislation Bill has passed its third and final reading in Parliament, with the support of almost all MPs.

node.title: House prices expected to fall further than previously forecast - ASB
node.description: The seemingly out of control housing market is being pegged back, with expectations of a greater fall in prices than previously thought.

node.title: Otago Girls' High School pupil attacked, hijab ripped off by fellow students
node.description: An Otago schoolgirl ended up in hospital with a concussion after three other pupils ripped her hijab off and beat her.

node.title: New Zealand sprinter happy to end Springbok ambitions
node.description: A budding Springbok as a youngster, sprinter Tiaan Whelpton is hoping to finally pull on the black singlet and represent New Zealand.

node.title: Sea levels to rise more than a foot by 2050, study projects
node.description: The forecasted increase over the next 30 years could amount to the same rise seen over the last 100 years.

node.title: Parliament protests: Tragedy or farce?

node.title: Coachella won't require masks, negative COVID tests or vaccinations
node.description: Guests will also not be required to bring masks.
